meanings.definition: A person, typically an adult, who accompanies and supervises a group of young people.
meanings.sent1: The chaperone made sure the students stayed together during the field trip.
meanings.sent2: The school dance required each group of students to have a chaperone present.
meanings.sent3: The chaperone joked with the students to keep the atmosphere light and fun.
meanings.sent4: The chaperone's watchful eyes were like a protective shield around the young group.
meanings.sent5: The chaperone's presence was reassuring to the parents, knowing their children were safe.

meanings.definition: To accompany and supervise a group of young people, typically as a chaperone.
meanings.sent1: She agreed to chaperone the students on their visit to the museum.
meanings.sent2: Parents often volunteer to chaperone school trips to ensure student safety.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to chaperone the rowdy group of kids on the bus ride.
meanings.sent4: Her responsibility to chaperone the children made her feel important and trusted.
meanings.sent5: The older sibling was asked to chaperone the younger ones at the park.
